title: Use uploaded logo in header (left) at medium size

requirements.text: Add the user-uploaded image `image-4.png` to the frontend static assets at `frontend/public/assets/generated/image-4.png` so it can be referenced by URL at runtime.

quotes: The user has uploaded 1 image(s): image-4.png.
Put this logo in the Header on the left, Medium sized

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting `/assets/generated/image-4.png` in the running app returns the image.

requirements.text: Update the app header logo in `frontend/src/components/layout/AppHeader.tsx` to use `/assets/generated/image-4.png`, positioned on the left side of the header, and style it to be medium-sized (smaller than the current `h-16 sm:h-20 md:h-24` sizing) while preserving aspect ratio (`w-auto` + `object-contain`).

quotes: Put this logo in the Header on the left, Medium sized

acceptanceCriteria: The header renders the logo on the left and it remains clickable (retains existing navigation behavior).
The logo uses `src="/assets/generated/image-4.png"` and does not appear stretched or cropped.
On mobile and desktop, the logo height is visibly reduced to a medium size compared to the current header logo sizing, without causing header layout overlap with the center CTA or right-side actions.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not change authentication logic or routing behavior tied to the header logo click.
nonGoals: Do not change the public landing page (AuthGate) hero logo unless explicitly requested.
Do not redesign the header layout beyond replacing the logo asset and adjusting its size.
